title: Lead Technical Artist - Words with Friends
content:
Position Overview
Zynga is seeking a knowledgeable and passionate Lead Technical Artist to join our amazing team on Words with Friends!  The Lead Technical Artist role involves highly creative problem-solving in various areas of our visual development process. This includes streamlining development pipelines, creating tools, discovering solutions to complex graphical challenges, and bringing inventive ideas to how we could elevate our player experience.  The Lead Technical Artist is also a leader that contributes strategic proposals, facilitates communication, and manages our team of high performing technical artists. The Lead Technical Artist will empower, support and guide others to excellence, acting as a role model for organizational, technical, and creative skills, helping to elevate both their team and the wider Zynga technical art community. This position will work closely with the Art Director, Leads, UX Designers, Engineers, Game Designers, Producers and other key players to take Words with Friends into the future!
Main Responsibilities 

Work closely with the Art, UX Designers, Game Designers and Engineering teams to construct and implement game assets in Unity
Maintain efficient performance for the gameâ€™s final visual assets, as well as work to effectively tackle any art-related bugs or hitches that may arise during production
Develop a foundational understanding of all systems in the game that touch art assets and effectively maintain these systems while rapidly addressing issues before they become problems
Define, maintain, enhance, and fix pipelines for in-game assets
Develop and maintain tools for the production pipeline, particularly for animation and technical art tasks
Create and leverage materials/shaders to aid in hitting established visual targets.
Create, maintain, and communicate technical art guidelines and implementation techniques.
Maintain clean, optimized project, periodically auditing assets and sprite atlases, etc
Profile builds and provide and implement solutions to address performance issues, bugs, and animation/VFX feedback
Be confident and comfortable providing original ideas and solutions to challenging issues throughout the production environment
Act as a go-to source of knowledge and provide training to other team members
Our ideal candidate is an authority in their craft. You are innovative, an excellent communicator, possess a deep knowledge of all things Unity, and have a strong grasp of asset optimization and mobile game performance. You are a contributor of ideas, overseer of pipelines, and collaborator across all parts of the game development process. You thrive when collaborating with others, providing mentorship while drawing from a wide range of skills, to deliver the best achievable results.

Desired Skills and Experience 

Experience at managing teams and individual contributors
Highly skilled at communication with team members across fields, including the written documentation of pipeline processes
Driven to stay knowledgeable of industry trends and technologies and share those takeaways with the larger technical artist community
Deep understanding of technical requirements of mobile game development
5+ years of experience and highly proficient with Unity
Scripting with C#
Working knowledge of MVVM software architectural pattern
Proficient with optimizing 3D and 2D assets for memory and performance considerations
Proficient with Adobe Creative Cloud Suites
Technical background in developing scripts, Photoshop actions, and other automation tools necessary for art implementation and optimization
Proficient with profiling tools
Collaborative and self motivated
Ability to support the game team with solving problems and technical assistance
Strong problem-solving methodology
5+ years experience in game development
A passion for games
Prior experience with version control software such as Perforce and Git
Animation and VFX proficiency is a major plus

What we offer you:

Competitive salary, bonus plan and ESPP (Employee Stock Purchase Plan)
401K Company Match Contribution (US)
RRSP/DPSP company match contribution (Canada)
Health coverage, dental, disability, critical illness, EAP, and life insurance (Canada)
Medical, dental, vision, EAP, life insurance, and disability benefits (US)
Virtual mental health and neurodiversity support programs
Global Fitness reimbursement program
Global Wellbeing Program
Financial wellness program with unlimited access to certified financial planners
Discretionary Time Off policy for many employees
Family planning support program
Generous paid parental, pregnancy-related disability, caregiver, and compassionate leaves
Subsidized Back-up child care
Zynga happy hours and frequent employee events
Flexible working hours on many teams
Culture of diversity and inclusion including employee resource groups
Work with cool people and impact millions of daily player
Zynga does not  engage in financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process. We do not conduct job interviews over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp or others. We will never ask you for your personal or financial information over unofficial chat channels. Our in-house recruitment team only contacts individuals via official company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com or naturalmotion.com email domain).
If you believe you have been the victim of a scam, you may wish to contact the authorities. In the United States, you may file a complaint with the FBI. More information is available here: https://www.ic3.gov.

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion Strategy we would like to collect demographic information from job candidates to identify and implement strategies to understand and improve equal opportunity for all at Zynga. Completion of this information is entirely voluntary and any details you provide will not be considered in the hiring process. Zynga will anonymize demographic information for reporting and analytics to gain a better understanding of our hiring process. This  information will only be used internally within Zynga and stored securely on our systems.  

For Zynga’s full privacy notice, click here for US Job Applicant privacy notice and here for the Outside of the US Job Applicant Privacy Notice . You can email Privacy@zynga.com for more information regarding the collections and use of your data.
